citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two goats had overgrown hooves with curled toes that had not been trimmed when necessary. Regular hoof trimming
prevents overgrowth of hoof wall that leads to abnormal gait, stress on feet and joints, and helps prevent the development
of chronic arthritic changes in the limbs. The facility must ensure that regular hoof trimming is performed as needed for
the animal's welfare.
Correct by July 6, 2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, two goats had overgrown hooves with curled toes that had not been noted by the facility during
daily observations. Overgrown hooves can impede normal mobility and activity, and should be noted on observations. The
facility must ensure that daily observations to assess health of animals are comprehensive and evaluate the whole
animal's well being.
Correct from June 29, 2023 forward.

Facility personnel stated that they had not updated the contingency plan since 2020. Annual updates to the contingency
plan ensure that changes to the facility program are accounted for in emergency planning. The facility must ensure that
they review and update the plan annually.
Correct by July 30 2023.

Facility personnel stated that training had not been provided to animal care personnel on the contingency plan. Training
on the emergency (contingency) plan within 30 days of hire ensures that personnel will be able to carry out their duties to
safeguard animal welfare in the event of an emergency. The facility must ensure that employees are trained on the
contingency plan.
Correct by July 30, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two goats had overgrown hooves with curled toes that had not been trimmed when necessary. Regular hoof trimming 
prevents overgrowth of hoof wall that leads to abnormal gait, stress on feet and joints, and helps prevent the development 
of chronic arthritic changes in the limbs. The facility must ensure that regular hoof trimming is performed as needed for 
the animal's welfare. 
 
Correct by July 6, 2023. 
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At the time of inspection, two goats had overgrown hooves with curled toes that had not been noted by the facility during 
daily observations. Overgrown hooves can impede normal mobility and activity, and should be noted on observations. The 
facility must ensure that daily observations to assess health of animals are comprehensive and evaluate the whole 
animal's well being. 
 
Correct from June 29, 2023 forward. 
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
Facility personnel stated that they had not updated the contingency plan since 2020. Annual updates to the contingency 
plan ensure that changes to the facility program are accounted for in emergency planning. The facility must ensure that 
they review and update the plan annually. 
 
Correct by July 30 2023. 
2.134(c) 
   
Contingency planning.

Facility personnel stated that training had not been provided to animal care personnel on the contingency plan. Training 
on the emergency (contingency) plan within 30 days of hire ensures that personnel will be able to carry out their duties to 
safeguard animal welfare in the event of an emergency. The facility must ensure that employees are trained on the 
contingency plan. 
 
Correct by July 30, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
